creditline: The John R. Van Derlip Fund
department: Chinese, South and Southeast Asian Art
description: Apron, for religious ceremonies, consisting of two wide and four narrow strips of embroidered white satin with elaborately scrolled ends finished with silk tasseled fringe.  The strips are suspended from a wide waistband of blue satin brocade of bat and long-life character design.  Lining of thin cerise silk.
title: Apron for Religous Ceremonies
